jaxfluids.iles package

Submodules

jaxfluids.iles.ALDM module

class jaxfluids.iles.ALDM.ALDM(domain_information: jaxfluids.domain_information.DomainInformation, material_manager: jaxfluids.materials.material_manager.MaterialManager)[source]

Bases: object

Adaptive Local Deconvolution Method - ALDM - Hickel et al. 2014

ALDM is a numerical scheme for computation of convective fluxes. It consits of a combined reconstruction and flux-function. ALDM is optimized to model subgrid-scale terms in underresolved LES.

ALDM consists of a 1) cell face reconstruction based on a convex sum of adapted WENO1, WENO3, and WENO5

2) flux-function with adjusted dissipation of SGS modeling and low Mach number consistency.

compute_fluxes_xi(prime: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, cons: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, axis: int, **kwargs) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Computes the numerical flux in the axis direction.

Parameters

  • prime (jax.Array) – Buffer of primitive variables.

  • cons (jax.Array) – Buffer of conservative variables.

  • axis (int) – Spatial direction in which the flux is computed.

Returns

Numerical flux in specified direction.

Return type

jax.Array

compute_phi(primes: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, cons: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Computes the phi vector which is the quantity that is reconstructed in the ALDM scheme.

phi vector notation different from paper,

ar{phi} = {ar{rho}, ar{u1}, ar{u2}, ar{u3}, ar{p}, ar{rho_e}}

Parameters

  • primes (jax.Array) – Buffer of primitive variables.

  • cons (jax.Array) – Buffer of conservative variables.

Returns

Buffer of the phi vector.

Return type

jax.Array

reconstruct_xi(phi: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, alpha_1: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, alpha_2: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, alpha_3: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, fs: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, axis: int, j: int, dx: Optional[float] = None) → Tuple[jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase][source]

Reconstructs the phi vector along the axis direction. Reconstruction is done via a convex combination of modified WENO1, WENO3 and WENO5.

Parameters

  • phi (jax.Array) – Buffer of phi vector.

  • alpha_1 (jax.Array) – First-order reconstruction weight.

  • alpha_2 (jax.Array) – Second-order reconstruction weight.

  • alpha_3 (jax.Array) – Third-order reconstruction weight.

  • fs (jax.Array) – Shock sensor.

  • axis (int) – Spatial direction along which reconstruction is done.

  • j (int) – Bit indicating whether reconstruction is left (j=0) or right (j=1) of the cell face.

  • dx (float, optional) – Vector of cell sizes in axis direction, defaults to None

Returns

Reconstructed phi vector and reconstructed third-oder pressure value.

Return type

Tuple[jax.Array, jax.Array]

solve_riemann_problem_xi(phi_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, phi_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, p3_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, p3_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, alpha_3: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, fs: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, axis: int) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Solves the Riemann problem, i.e., calculates the numerical flux, in the direction specified by axis.

phi = [rho, u1, u2, u3, p, rho_e] p3_K is third-order pressure reconstruction

Parameters

  • phi_L (jax.Array) – Phi vector of left neighboring state

  • phi_R (jax.Array) – Phi vector of right neighboring state

  • p3_L (jax.Array) – Third-order pressure reconstruction of left neighboring state

  • p3_R (jax.Array) – Third-order pressure reconstruction of right neighboring state

  • alpha_3 (jax.Array) – Third-order reconstruction weight

  • fs (jax.Array) – Shock sensor.

  • axis (int) – Spatial direction along which flux is calculated.

Returns

Numerical flux in axis drection.

Return type

jax.Array

reconstruct_xi(primes: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, axis: int, j: int, dx: Optional[float] = None, fs=0) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Reconstruction of buffer quantity along axis specified by axis.

Parameters

  • buffer (jax.Array) – Buffer that will be reconstructed

  • axis (int) – Spatial axis along which values are reconstructed

  • j (int) – integer which specifies whether to calculate reconstruction left (j=0) or right (j=1) of an interface

  • dx (float, optional) – cell size, defaults to None

Returns

Buffer with cell face reconstructed values

Return type

jax.Array
